resources.string: The Search by Name Page allows you to enter the name of the drink you are looking for or scroll to browse all drinks. Select a drink to view its ingredients, rate it, or add it to your favorite drinks.

The Results Page shows the drinks you will like the most to the drinks that you will like the least from top to bottom that fit your search constraints. If you have rated the drink, your rating shows in yellow stars and if you have not yet rated the drink, then our predicted rating for you shows in red stars. Click on a drink to view its info page.

The Drink Info page contains the given drink\'s ingredients list, flavor profile, and your current rating for the drink. By clicking the stars you can change your rating. If you would like to save this drink, add it to your favorites list by clicking the \'Add to Favorites\' under the picture.

Advanced Search is a combination of Search By Ingredient, Search By Flavor, and Search By Category. Select a category, ingredients to include, and flavor intensities. Press and hold down on a category to see a description of it.
Search by flavor allows you to get drink recommendations based on your flavor preferences. Slide each seek bar to change the flavor intensity from 0 (least intense) to 5 (most intense).

Your Favorite Drinks page is where you can view, edit, and remove drinks that you have previously saved in your favorite drinks list. You may click on any drink and you will be taken to its drink info page where you can re-rate the drink at any time. Press \'Edit\' to edit and remove drinks from your list.
Try Something New is the quickest way to get drink recommendations tailored to your preferences. We evaluate your current rated drinks and recommend drinks based on those.
Press an icon to select the category of cocktail you want. Press and hold an icon to see information about that category. Select a category to view your search results.

Search By Ingredients allows you to get drink recommendations by selecting the ingredients that you would like your drink results to contain. Check the box next to the ingredient to add it to your search. You can type ingredients into the search box above and it will filter to the ingredients that start with the letters you have entered. You may check any boxes, and delete your text to view all ingredients again. Your boxes will stay checked. Click the \'Search\' button to complete your search.

Welcome to OneDrinkAway, the ultimate cocktail recommendation application!

Search By Name
		•Browse all of our drink recipes in alphabetical order, as well as enter a specific drink name.

Search By Category
		•Look for drinks by category, such as popular, frozen, and highball. Press and hold down on a category to get a description of it.

Search By Ingredients
		•Look for drinks by entering various ingredients. Enter a name of an ingredient to filter by, then check the check box to include it in your search. Press search once you are finished.

Search by Flavors
		•Looks for drinks by entering various flavor intensities. Slide the seek bar of the flavor to include it in your search, then press Search.

Favorite Drinks List
		•Keeps track of all of your favorite drinks. You can favorite a drink when on that drink's info page. Press Edit to remove drinks from the list.

Advanced Search
		•A combination of Search By Category, Ingredients, and Flavors that's designed for more specific searches

Try Something New
		•Suggests a drink for you at the touch of a button! Also known as...the drunk button.

A drop shot, or "bomb shot," is a mixed drink that is made by mixing two drinks. A drink in a small glass (typically a shot glass) is dropped into a larger glass holding a different drink. The resulting cocktail is typically consumed as quickly as possible.
A Classic cocktail is defined as a cocktail which appeared after the publication of Jerry Thomas\' 1887 Bar-Tender\'s Guide but before the end of Prohibition in the United States in 1934.
Many of these drinks are blended with ice, though some use ice cream and they often include fresh fruit.
Highballs are drinks consisting of whiskey and a mixer such as soda or ginger ale, served with ice in a tall glass.
Hot cocktails are served hot and usually made with brown liquors and heavy creams and spiced with seasonal flavors, like cinnamon and mint.
The Martini is a cocktail made with gin and vermouth, and garnished with an olive or a lemon twist. Over the years, the Martini has become one of the best-known mixed alcoholic beverages.
"On the Rocks" is a term used when referring to a straight shot of liquor poured in a short glass filled with ice
Lots of people like it. Duh.

Shooters are short, potent drinks that are mixed with a combination of spirits, liqueurs, and non-alcoholic mixers. Both shooters and shots are served in shot glasses and consumed with one tip of the glass.
Shots are short, potent drinks that are mixed with a combination of epirits and liqueurs. Both shooters and shots are served in shot glasses and consumed with one tip of the glass.
Tropical cocktails generally have a basis of gin, whisky, rum, or brandy combined with vermouth or fruit juices. They are often flavored with bitters or grenadine.
Also known as "Neat." A drink served up (or straight up) is one in which the ingredients are chilled by either shaking or stirring, then strained into a glass, typically a cocktail glass.
Your favorite drink list is currently empty.
Welcome To One Drink Away! Rate some drinks to get started.
Rating drinks allows us to make the best possible recommendations for you. If you do not rate any drinks, our suggestions will not be as accurate.

To rate our most common drinks, press the Rate Common Drinks tab. To look at all of the drinks in our database, press the Find and Rate tab. To rate a drink, press the number of stars you want to rate it on the rating bar below the name of the drink. When you are finished rating drinks, press the "Finish" button.
